citations.narrative:
The animal inventory at the time of inspection was 51 total. This number exceeds the maximum number of 50 animals
allowed under the current license.
The USDA license authorizes a specific number of animals to ensure that the facility and personnel possess adequate
facilities to provide sufficient husbandry to the regulated animals. A licensee must obtain a new license before any change
resulting in more than the authorized number of animals on hand at any single point in time during the period of licensure.
The licensee must reapply for a license that properly reflects the number of regulated animals under the license or reduce
the number of regulated animals to a number which is under the maximum threshold authorized under the current license.
To be corrected by 02 April, 2024.

The licensee is lacking an updated animal inventory reflecting the currently housed 8 African pygmy dormice and 9 Syrian
hamsters. Inventory records allow Animal Care officials to track regulated animals. A current inventory with all required
information must be maintained for animals on hand, any offspring born on premises, and animals sold or dead. These
records need to be updated and maintained in a timely and accurate manner for record keeping purposes.
To be correct by 02 April, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.1(b)(2)(i) 
   
Requirements and application 
The animal inventory at the time of inspection was 51 total. This number exceeds the maximum number of 50 animals 
allowed under the current license. 
The USDA license authorizes a specific number of animals to ensure that the facility and personnel possess adequate 
facilities to provide sufficient husbandry to the regulated animals. A licensee must obtain a new license before any change 
resulting in more than the authorized number of animals on hand at any single point in time during the period of licensure. 
The licensee must reapply for a license that properly reflects the number of regulated animals under the license or reduce 
the number of regulated animals to a number which is under the maximum threshold authorized under the current license. 
To be corrected by 02 April, 2024. 
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee is lacking an updated animal inventory reflecting the currently housed 8 African pygmy dormice and 9 Syrian 
hamsters. Inventory records allow Animal Care officials to track regulated animals. A current inventory with all required 
information must be maintained for animals on hand, any offspring born on premises, and animals sold or dead. These 
records need to be updated and maintained in a timely and accurate manner for record keeping purposes. 
To be correct by 02 April, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
